definition: To burn or incinerate something, typically referring to the deliberate act of setting fire to waste materials, such as gases, liquids, or solids. This term is commonly employed in industrial or chemical contexts, where controlled burning is carried out to dispose of unwanted substances or excess materials.

examples.english: The factory was set on fire.

examples.german: Die Demonstranten drohten damit, das Gebäude abzufackeln.
examples.english: The protesters threatened to torch the building.

examples.german: Sie fackelten das Auto ab, um ihre Spuren zu verwischen.
examples.english: They set fire to the car to cover their tracks.

examples.german: Die Rebellen fackelten die Brücke ab, um den Feind aufzuhalten.
examples.english: The rebels burned down the bridge to stop the enemy.

examples.german: Er wurde beschuldigt, das Haus abgefackelt zu haben.
examples.english: He was accused of setting the house on fire.
